First, the code structure:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <math.h>

// Function to compute GCD
int gcd(int a, int b) {
    while (b != 0) {
        int temp = b;
        b = a % b;
        a = temp;
    }
    return a;
}

int main() {
    int N, M;
    char S[1000], T[1000];
    char s_str[1000], t_str[1000]; // To hold the input strings after reading

    // Read N and M
    scanf("%d %d", &N, &M);
    // Read S and T, removing newlines
    fgets(s_str, sizeof(s_str), stdin);
    fgets(t_str, sizeof(t_str), stdin);

    // Remove trailing newlines from S and T
    s_str[strcspn(s_str, "\n")] = 0;
    t_str[strcspn(t_str, "\n")] = 0;

    strcpy(S, s_str);
    strcpy(T, t_str);

    // Now process first part's logic
    int Flag = 0;
    int Kaburi_j_count = 0;
    int Kaburi_j[1000]; // Assuming M is up to 1000, but need to adjust if needed
    int Kaburi_i[1000];

    // First, find all j's where j = (i*M)/N for some i, and j is integer
    // We can use an array to track which j's are present
    int present_j[M]; // indexes 0 to M-1
    memset(present_j, 0, sizeof(present_j));

    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        int temp = i * M;
        if (temp % N == 0) {
            int j = temp / N;
            if (j >= 0 && j < M) { // j must be in 0..M-1
                present_j[j] = 1;
            }
        }
    }

    // Collect all j's where present_j[j] is 1
    Kaburi_j_count = 0;
    for (int j = 0; j < M; j++) {
        if (present_j[j] == 1) {
            Kaburi_j[Kaburi_j_count] = j;
            Kaburi_i[Kaburi_j_count] = (j * N) / M; // since j = (i*M)/N → i = (j*N)/M
            Kaburi_j_count++;
        }
    }

    // Now check all pairs
    Flag = 0;
    for (int k = 0; k < Kaburi_j_count; k++) {
        int i = Kaburi_i[k];
        int j = Kaburi_j[k];
        if (S[i] != T[j]) {
            Flag = 1;
            break;
        }
    }

    // Compute LCM if needed
    int lcm;
    if (Flag == 0) {
        int g = gcd(N, M);
        lcm = (N * M) / g;
    }

    // Generate intermediate string
    char intermediate_str[20];
    if (Flag) {
        strcpy(intermediate_str, "-1");
    } else {
        sprintf(intermediate_str, "%d", lcm);
    }

    // Now process second part's logic
    int count[256] = {0};
    int len = strlen(intermediate_str);
    for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
        char c = intermediate_str[i];
        count[c]++;
    }

    int odd_count = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
        if (count[i] % 2 != 0) {
            odd_count++;
        }
    }

    if (odd_count <= 1) {
        printf("First\n");
    } else {
        if (len % 2 == 0) {
            printf("Second\n");
        } else {
            printf("First\n");
        }
    }

    return 0;
}

Now, the code can be written as follows:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

int gcd(int a, int b) {
    while (b != 0) {
        int temp = b;
        b = a % b;
        a = temp;
    }
    return a;
}

int main() {
    int N, M;
    char S[1000], T[1000];
    char s_str[1000], t_str[1000];

    scanf("%d %d", &N, &M);
    fgets(s_str, sizeof(s_str), stdin);
    fgets(t_str, sizeof(t_str), stdin);

    s_str[strcspn(s_str, "\n")] = 0;
    t_str[strcspn(t_str, "\n")] = 0;

    strcpy(S, s_str);
    strcpy(T, t_str);

    int Flag = 0;

    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        int temp = i * M;
        if (temp % N == 0) {
            int j = temp / N;
            if (S[i] != T[j]) {
                Flag = 1;
                break;
            }
        }
    }

    char intermediate_str[20];
    if (Flag) {
        strcpy(intermediate_str, "-1");
    } else {
        int g = gcd(N, M);
        int lcm = (N * M) / g;
        sprintf(intermediate_str, "%d", lcm);
    }

    int count[256] = {0};
    int len = strlen(intermediate_str);
    for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
        char c = intermediate_str[i];
        count[c]++;
    }

    int odd_count = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
        if (count[i] % 2 != 0) {
            odd_count++;
        }
    }

    if (odd_count <= 1) {
        printf("First\n");
    } else {
        if (len % 2 == 0) {
            printf("Second\n");
        } else {
            printf("First\n");
        }
    }

    return 0;
}

Wait, but in the first part's code, the check is done for all i where (i*M) mod N ==0. For each such i, compute j and check S[i] vs T[j]. If any of them differ, Flag is set to 1.
